question: In which year the Guatemalan coup d'etat, also code-named as "Operation PBSuccess", happened?
explanation: In the year 1954 the Guatemalan coup d'etat, also code-named as "Operation PBSuccess", happened. The 1954 Guatemalan coup d'etat, code-named Operation PBSuccess, was a covert operation carried out by the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) that deposed the democratically elected Guatemalan President Jacobo Arbenz and ended the Guatemalan Revolution of 1944â€“1954. It installed the military dictatorship of Carlos Castillo Armas, the first in a series of U.S.-backed authoritarian rulers in Guatemala.
